Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2018 08:14AM Jules111 wrote: I have lots and lots of dizziness after radiation. You are not alone. I have also felt nausea. Each time I tell my doctors, they tell me it is not caused by radiation. The worst has been two weeks after radiation treatments ended. Good luck . You are not crazy. I also want to add that I am a person who takes NO other medications or even aspirin. My body is not used to "treatments" and it feels the effects of radiation very strongly.
Posts.Title: Radiation causing nausea and dizziness marymary897 Motherofall6

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2018 08:35AM Jules111 wrote: I am really amazed at the lack of concern and even denial by doctos about the effects from radiation. What is going on? Are they afraid o being sued? They had the nerve to tell me that radiation does not cause dizziness at all. One doctor asked me five times what other meds I am taking. Each time I said, "None." I am so tired and dizzy I can hardly type this and it is two weeks after the radiation stopped. One nurse told me there is a dip in post-radiation treatment that occurs about now. Just can't believe the doctors insist radiation ONLY causes fatigue.
Posts.Title: Radiation causing nausea and dizziness marymary897 Motherofall6

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2018 07:16AM Jules111 wrote: Good luck! How did it work out? Too bad your hospital doesn't have a free place for you to stay. We need a network of women suffering from breast cancer to help each other out in such instances.
